intro: Blepharocalyx ellipticus, commonly known as the white bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its bell-shaped, white or pale pink flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant has elliptical, glossy leaves and is often found in moist, shaded environments. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and botanical collections.
